title: Kew
summary: Kew (/kjuː/) is a district in the London Borough of Richmond upon Thames, 1.5 miles (2.4 km) north-east of Richmond[2] and 7.1 miles (11.4 km) west by south-west of Charing Cross; its population at the 2011 census was 11,436.[1] Kew is the location of the Royal Botanic Gardens ("Kew Gardens"), now a World Heritage Site, which includes Kew Palace. Kew is also the home of important historical documents such as Domesday Book, which is held at The National Archives.
